descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
TOPIC: Methods of Inquiry from Sherlock Holmes to the Frontiers of Science

We will discuss the diversity of methods of human investigation, as well as their reach. Sherlock Holmes calls himself a master of deduction. However, as we will learn his work is best understood as a form of induction. We will discuss the scope and limits of induction and deduction of each of these methods of inquiry, with special interest in two questions (i) how do they help us predict the future? and (ii) how do they figure in science?

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will get acquainted with philosophical problems with a direct impact on everyday life. - students will do substantive work on their writing skills. - students will improve their analytical talents - students will be motivated to learn more about contemporary philosophy

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Almost all the readings will be short extracts available on Canvas. However, we will read most of the following book, which is required: Tetlock and Gardner, "Superforecasting" Crown Publishers ISBN-13: 978-0804136693
